lead_paragraph: For the last few seasons, a running theme in the N.F.L. has been running back Jamal Lewis’s dominance against the Cleveland Browns’ defense. The Browns ended that threat by signing Lewis in the off-season and naming him the team’s starting tailback. A leading candidate to take over his dominance is WILLIE PARKER, the Steelers’ fleet-footed running back.
